metadata.Title: CVE-2021-32837 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
mechanize, a library for automatically interacting with HTTP web servers, contains a regular expression that is vulnerable to regular expression denial of service (ReDoS) prior to version 0.4.6. If a web server responds in a malicious way, then mechanize could crash. Version 0.4.6 has a patch for the issue.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-32837` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python3-mechanize - 1:0.4.8+pypi-5
No subscription required

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Erik Krogh Kristensen and Rasmus Petersen from the GitHub Security Lab

criterions.comment: python-mechanize package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:0.4.8+pypi-5').
